### commit specifications ğŸ“

- featï¼šNew features
- fixï¼š Fix Bug
- docsï¼šDocument update
- styleï¼šCode modification that does not affect the program logic (modify the blank characters, format indent, complete the missing semicolons, etc., without changing the code logic)
- refactorï¼šRefactoring code (neither new feature nor bug fix)
- perfï¼šPerformance, experience optimization
- testï¼šAdd the new test cases or update the existing tests
- buildï¼šThe main purpose is to modify the submission of the project building system (such as glup, webpack, rollup configuration, etc.)
- ciï¼šThe main purpose is to modify the submission of project continued integration processes (e. g. Travis, Jenkins, GitLab CI, Circle, etc.)
- choreï¼šOther classes that do not belong to the above types, such as building processes, dependency management
- revertï¼šRoll back some earlier previous submission
- version: Change the package.json version

### ğŸ¤ You should, according on the type of change, choose... English: and a space character ğŸ‘‡

```bash

feat: your commit

```
